questions.text: A 29-year-old woman presents with a one-year history of irregular periods, deteriorating hirsutism, and weight gain. Which one of the following statements is most probable for this patient? Investigations reveal: Serum testosterone 4 mmol/L (0.5-3) Serum dehydroepiandrosterone sulphate(DHEAS) 15 μmol/L (0.3-9.3)

options.label: A
options.text: She has no risk for endometrial carcinoma.

options.label: B
options.text: She has an increased risk of multiple pregnancies

options.label: C
options.text: She is at increased risk of autoimmune disease

options.label: D
options.text: She is likely to develop acanthosis nigricans

questions.correct_answer: D. She is likely to develop acanthosis nigricans
questions.explanation:
Solution:

She is likely to develop acanthosis nigricans This patient has oligo-menorrhea, weight gain, and hirsutism. The investigations show a modest elevation of androgens and support a diagnosis of polycystic ovarian syndrome . This condition is associated with insulin resistance and acanthosis nigricans is a feature. Insulin resistance also leads to hyperpigmented velvety patches of skin in the nape of neck/ axilla/ below breast or thigh called acanthosis nigricans and in future patients can develop diabetes.

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option: A PCOS are at risk for endometrial hyperplasia and carcinoma. Option: B Patient generally presents with decreased fertility. Option: C It is also associated with obesity, type 2 diabetes, and premature atherosclerosis, all of which may be indicative of an underlying metabolic disorder.

questions.text: A 22-year-old lady comes with hirsutism due to PCOS, drugs used for the treatment of her hirsutism are:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Spironolactone Spironolactone therapy is initiated if OCP use is not an option for the treatment of hirsutism or if results from OCP therapy are suboptimal.

Highyeild:

spironolactone: It is an androgen receptor antagonist. It is an antialdosterone diuretic. It also inhibits androgen biosynthesis from the ovary and adrenal . Inhibits 5α-reductase activity. It competes with androgen at the receptor sites. Side effects are Menstrual irregularity (DUB), fatigue, diuresis and, electrolyte imbalance ( hyperkalemia ). Androgen receptor antagonists – like spironolactone, cyproterone acetate, and flutamide . These antiandrogens are competitive inhibitors of androgen binding to the androgen receptor and can be used to treat hirsutism.

questions.text: A 16-YEAR-OLD girl presents with rapid onset hirsutism and amenorrhea. The best investigation is:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Testosterone estimation A variety of ovarian neoplasms , both benign a nd malignant may produce testosterone and lead to virilization . Specifically, women with an abrupt onset, typically within several months . Symptoms may include deepening of the voice, frontal balding, severe acne or hirsutism, or both, increased muscle mass, and clitoromegaly. Total testosterone beyond 200 ng /dl of warrant evaluation for an ovarian lesion. Therefore testosterone estimation is the best investigation in case of rapid onset hirsutism and amenorrhea.

Highyeild:

Causes of Hirsutism: Hirsutism is associated with excess androgen production (either from ovaries or adrenals), so any cause which increases androgens causes hirsutism. Most of the testosterone is bound to sex hormone-binding globulin (SHBG) and is considered biologically inactive. Testosterone which is not bound to SHBG is considered biologically active, therefore any factor which decreases SHBG; causes an increase in free testosterone and therefore causes hirsutism.

Therefore, serum DHEAS levels above 700 mcg/dl are highly sensitive to the presence of an adrenal neoplasm. Adrenal imaging with abdominal CT or MRI is indicated for any patient with DHEAS levels that exceed this value. Options C and D : are not appropriate.

questions.text: You are using the Ferriman Gallwey scoring system to assess hirsutism in a patient. Hirsutism is diagnosed when the score is more than:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

8 a score of 8 or higher is regarded as indicative of androgen excess.

Highyeild:

Ferriman-Gallwey scoring is a scoring method for detecting hirsutism. In the original system — hair growth at 11 sites was noted- Upper lip Lower abdomen Chin Upper arms Chest Forearms Upper back Thighs Lower back Legs Upper abdomen In the modified METHOD —2 sites were deleted-forearm s and legs. Thus in the modified scoring system – hair growth is seen at 9 sites . In each of the nine locations, a score between 0-4 is given depending on the growth of terminal hair Maximum score= 36 In Caucasian women, a score of 8 or higher is regarded as indicative of androgen excess. Modified Ferriman-Gallwey scoring METHOD

questions.text: In PCOD, which of the following drugs is not used for infertility?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Spironolactone Spironolactone is not used for treating infertility. It can be used to treat hirsutism . It is an androgen receptor antagonist. It is an antialdosterone diuretic. It also inhibits androgen biosynthesis from the ovary and adrenal . Inhibits 5α-reductase activity. It competes with androgen at the receptor sites. Side effects are Menstrual irregularity (DUB), fatigue, diuresis and electrolyte imbalance ( hyperkalemia ).

Extraedge:

Management of Infertility due to PCOD In PCOD-the basic cause of infertility is anovulation It is easily reversible and treatable using ovulation-inducing drugs First, advise weight loss (In 5-10% cases-weight loss will cause resumption of ovulation) 1st line drugs-SERM'S Clomiphene citrate-DOC for ovulation induction in PCOS patients Tamoxifen-given to patients who cannot tolerate clomiphene. Raloxifene-Not used for ovulation induction 2nd line agents Gonadotropins: LH/FSH injection Insulin Sensitizers M/C used drug: Metformin Metformin is added when clomiphene citrate is not showing any effect and the patient is obese It will help the patient to lose weight M/C side effect-GI upset Most dangerous side effects-Lactic acidosis Metformin is safe during pregnancy 3rd line agents: GnRH agonist a) Leuprolide b) Guserelin has given in a pulsatile manner c) Nafarelin Surgery for PCOS It is reserved for cases not responding to medical therapy Laparoscopic Ovarian Drilling (LOD) or Laparoscopic Electrocoagulation of Ovarian Surface (LEOS) Monopolar current or Laser is passed within the ovary to destroy the ovarian theca when very high doses of gonadotropins are required for ovulation. Advantages: no risk of Ovarian hyperstimulation syndrome and multiple pregnancies Disadvantages: if excessive ovarian tissue is damaged, it can lead to premature ovarian failure.
